poem:
"Of Political Gambles"

In the relentless cycle of 
Red and blue,
Leaders rise, fall,
As marbles in a game.

May stumbled, nearly lost,
Johnson held firm, a bank unto himself,
Sunak steps without predecessors' well-worn path,
A gamble in hand.

Oh, the convolution of these
Early Election Guns,
Their wake, a bitter brew,
In the theatre of ballot unbinding.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From first impressions to tactical voting: how the UK election will be won or lost Here we go again. For the third time in a row, the general election starting gun has been fired early by a Conservative prime minister. Theresa May started well ahead and nearly lost it all. Boris Johnson started well ahead and took that lead to the bank. Rishi Sunak doesn’t start with his predecessors’ advantages – his is the gamble". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
